description: This is a Python script for a command-line interface (CLI) tool called 'Universal Project Initializer'. It handles project creation, configuration parsing, and retrieving build/run commands for various project types, with extensive argument parsing and template handling.

classes.name: ProjectConfig
classes.description: Configuration object for a project, including name, version, description, author, type, output path, and parameters.

classes.name: ProjectType
classes.description: Enumeration or class representing different project types, with a method to parse from string.

classes.name: ProjectInitializer
classes.description: Main class responsible for initializing projects, creating templates, and executing setup procedures.

classes.name: TemplateInitInfo
classes.description: Data structure containing initialization commands and environment info for project templates.

methods.name: parse_parameters
methods.description: Parses a comma-separated string of key=value pairs into a dictionary with appropriate data types.

methods.name: create_project_config
methods.description: Creates a ProjectConfig object from CLI arguments.

methods.name: create_minimal_project_config
methods.description: Creates a minimal ProjectConfig for retrieving template info, mainly for internal use.

methods.name: make_path_absolute
methods.description: Converts a relative path to an absolute path based on a base directory.

methods.name: template_init_info_to_dict
methods.description: Converts TemplateInitInfo object into a dictionary with absolute paths for JSON serialization.

methods.name: output_json
methods.description: Outputs a JSON-formatted result indicating success or failure, with optional template info.

methods.name: output_get_run_command
methods.description: Outputs the run command for a specific project type in JSON format.

methods.name: handle_get_run_command
methods.description: Handles the logic for retrieving the run command for a given project type.

methods.name: main
methods.description: Main entry point for the CLI, handling argument parsing, project creation, and command execution.
